page.title: 14WALKINGTON SOCIAL CONCERNS.
page.content: BASED ON A SURVEY OF 200 HOUSEHOLDERS 73% OF THE VILLAGERS ARE UNHAPPY ABOUT THE HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS,ALTHOUGH MANY OF THEM LIVE IN THE EARLY 70's ESTATES WHICH MADE FAR GREATER LOCAL IMPACT. REASONS FOR DISSATISFACTION ARE a_BAD DESIGN NOT APPROPRIATE FOR A VILLAGE; b_BUILDING DENSITY AND THE LOSS OF GREEN AREAS;c_THE LOSS OF A VILLAGE ENVIRONMENT. 11% OF THE POPULATION QUOTED THE "VILLAGE ATMOSPHERE" AS THE MOST DESIRABLE QUALITIES ABOUT WALKINGTON AND DID NOT WANT TO SEE IT DISAPPEAR. PACKED PUBLIC MEETINGS HAD CHOSEN "INFILLING",WITH A STRICT LIMITATION ON BUILDING BOUNDARIES TO PRESERVE CERTAIN GREEN AREAS,eg THE NORTHGATE PADDOCK,AND TO KEEP WITHIN THE BUILDING ENVELOPE.THE PARISH COUNCIL WITH THE BOROUGH COUNCIL WERE TO SERVE AS WATCHDOGS OVER THE DEVELOPMENTS.
